comment.author: 43688219@N00
comment._content: Hercules Montagu Edwin Bradshaw Medal Index Card reference WO 372/3/35096 Second Lieutenant Hampshire Regiment Lieutenant \ Acting Captain Tank Corps Acting Captain Motor Machine Gun Service Royal Artillery discovery.nationalarchives.gov.uk/SearchUI/Details?uri=D1... On the 1911 census the 13 year old Hercules Montagu Edwin Bradshaw, born Chiswick, London, was recorded as an "Inmate" at a School, Stubbington House, Stubbington, near Fareham, Hampshire. Going back to the 1901 census the 3 year old Hercules M E was recorded at Park Road, Bexhill, Sussex. This was the household of his parents, Arthur E, (aged 36, Living on own means, and originally from Weymouth, Dorset) and Elizabeth, (aged 35 and from Kenilworth, Warwickshire). As well as Hercules, their other children at that time were: Elizabeth E................aged 8..............born Richmond, Surrey Kathleen B................aged 7...............born Weymouth, Dorset Arthur W A.................aged 6..............born Bitterne, Hampshire The family also have four live in servants. In the London Gazette of the 23rd January 1917, Lt H H M E Bradshaw, (Hampshire Regiment, Special Reserve) to be acting Captain while commanding a Battalion. 13th December 1916. www.london-gazette.co.uk/issues/29918/supplements/939 London Gazette 15th April 1921. Machine Gun Corps (Motor) Lieutenant H M E Bradshaw M C (Hampshire Regiment), ceases to be employed with the Corps 25th November 1920 www.london-gazette.co.uk/issues/32293/supplements/3067 In the London Gazette of the 4th April 1930 it is noted that Captain Hercules Montagu Edwin Bradshaw, M C, , Reserve of Officers, was to be Captain, 5th/7tth Battalion of the Hampshire Regiment with effect form the 5th April. www.london-gazette.co.uk/issues/33594/pages/2147 The death of a Hercules M E Bradshaw, aged 64, was recorded in the Droxford District of Hampshire in the January to March quarter of 1962.

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: In the London Gazette 1 September 1914 Acting Second Lieutenant (on probation) Hercules Montagu Edwin Bradshaw 3rd Battalion, The Hampshire Regiment. www.london-gazette.co.uk/issues/28886/pages/6904/page.pdf In the London Gazette 22 June 1915 he is confirmed in his rank www.london-gazette.co.uk/issues/29201/pages/6028/page.pdf In the Supplement to the Edinburgh Gazette September 18, 1918. AWARDED THE MILITARY CROSS. Lt. (Act./Capt.) Hercules Montagu Edwin Bradshaw, Hamps. R. For conspicuous gallantry and devotion to duty. This officer disposed and commanded his battery with great skill when he was directed to assist an infantry brigade in repelling several enemy attacks, remaining for twenty-four hours exposed to heavy shellfire, and causing severe casualties to the enemy. On another occasion he very materially assisted in beating off hostile attacks, and he covered the retirement of the division in a most able manner, displaying great gallantry and coolness under very heavy fire. www.edinburgh-gazette.co.uk/issues/13322/pages/3361/page.pdf

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content:
Birth of Hercules Montagu E Bradshaw registered 3rd qr 1897 in Brentford

Marriage of Hercules M E Bradshaw to Ethel M Garnet Mellor in Thanet registered 2nd qr 1941
Marriage of Hercules M E Bradshaw to Shirley I Waistell in Gosport registered 3rd qr 1954

Death of Hercules M E Bradshaw registered 1st qr 1962 age 64, in Droxford

Possibly one daughter - Katherine E Bradshaw (mother Waistell) birth registration 3rd qr 1959 in Southampton
